article.headline: Buffalo 81, Canisius 76
article.story: AMHERST, N.Y. (AP) -- Roderick Middleton's 3-pointer with 27 seconds remaining sealed Buffalo's 81-76 win over Canisius Friday night. Calvin Cage led the Bulls (1-0) with 22 points, while Mario Jordan had 16 and Parnell Smith 12. Middleton finished with 14 points. Kevin Downey led the Golden Griffins (0-1) with 20 points, nine rebounds and five assists. Corey Herring scored 15 points, while Chuck Harris and Jon Popofski had 11 apiece. Buffalo led 37-35 at the half after Middleton's buzzer-beating tip-in. Canisius hit six of their first eight shots and led by seven points soon after the break. But Cage responded with a 3-pointer as the Bulls went on an 11-point run. Canisius closed within two points with seven seconds remaining, with Popofski's foul putting Middleton at the line. Middleton hit one of two shots.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
